concept.title: Not a feasible solution. What now?
concept.shortdesc: Possibilities for next steps if the Solver can not find an answer.

conbody.p: Regularly the Solver reports that no solution could be found:

image.alt: Dialog box when the solver could not find a feasible solution

ol.li: There is no solution to the formulated problem.
There is a solution to the formulated problem, but the Solver could not find it.

conbody.p: In most cases, you don't know with certainty which situation is present. There are a few guidelines to investigate whether the solution can be found by the Solver.

section.title: Changing start values variable cells
section.p: Whether it is possible for the Solver to find a solution or not depends on the starting values of the variable cells, among other things. Experimenting with different starting values can sometimes help to find a solution.

section.title: Changing Solver options
section.p: Finding a solution also depends on how the Solver works. The search for a solution follows a so-called iterative process. An iteration is the repeated recalculation of a worksheet until a specific condition is met. The Solver has several settings for this iteration process. Clicking the button Options in the dialog box Solver Parameters displays a window for changing several options of the Solver.

The dialog box offers extensive possibilities for the solution process. Specifications for certain problems can be saved as a model and reloaded. A few of these settings are listed below and discussed shortly.

strow.stentry: The maximum seconds the solver may spend at the iteration process.
The degree of precision for a constraint to be considered satisfied. The smaller the number, the higher the precision.
The maximal error percentage allowed by integer solutions. The value is only relevant when a restriction with an integer is present. The smaller the error rate, the longer the search process takes.
Only use it when all relationships in the calculation model are linear. The choice may then speed up the search process. Using with non-linear models can ensure that no solution is found.
To see the values of each trial solution. Not normally use.
